thread.title: The Pour Fool: What to Drink from the World and NW
thread.title_full: The Pour Fool: What to Drink from the World and NW

title: The Pour Fool: What to Drink from the World and NW
text: By The Pour Fool  50 PM My God…these were not just beers, not for me. These were Beer College. Experiences. Every time. … Intrinsic and Inferno: Steps Into The New Frontier of Wine By The Pour Fool   5:00 PM There is NO reason at all why that grape juice cannot be manipulated and tweaked and enhanced by thoughtful winemakers. … Garrett Marrero and an Attempted Cranial Extraction from The Rectal Cavity By The Pour Fool on March 9, 2017 at 10:54 AM The craft beer community – and those who are its knee-jerk detractors – often latch onto “mistakes” and outright lies far more tightly than to actual, provable, facts. … Pyramid Brewing Hits Its Groove – Again By The Pour Fool  07 PM Pyramid may well have been off the map for a while but, today, It’s Back and it’s making its considerable bones all over again. … By The Pour Fool on February 28, 2017 at 1:44 PM The new, as yet unreleased, Knudsen Vineyards Chardonnay 2015 is…jaw-dropping. … The Blackberry Farm Brewery: A Tennessee Miracle By The Pour Fool  26 PM I found these ales flat-damned addictive; a delightful respite from that endless succession of British-tradition ales that account for 90% of all beers made at the nation’s craft breweries. … Full Sail, pFriem, Fish Brewing, etc.: The CDA Emerges from Darkness By The Pour Fool on February 22, 2017 at 9:24 AM Cascadian. Dark. Ale. Three words which, taken one by one, are fairly easy to define. But put those three together and you get…something murky. … Off Topic: Taxes, Trump, and The Big Flim-Flam By The Pour Fool on February 14, 2017 at 11:00 AM It is totally out of character to think that a shock ‘n’ awe financial picture which would bolster the Trump name and cement him as a presumptive candidate for a second term in 2020 wouldn’t be made public.
